column1: 2021-01-27 07:30:00#local#Biden's inauguration got higher TV ratings than Trump's 2017 swearing-in#https://news.yahoo.com/bidens-inauguration-got-higher-tv-073035415.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/G3gOcc6XlFzfcGH07RsaHA--~B/aD01NjA7dz04NDA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_week_574/6e8810bcee0efedc636786303f7a5cc9#en#0.0#news.yahoo.com#For anyone inclined to care about such things
column2: President Biden's inauguration last Wednesday drew higher ratings that former President Trump's swearing-in four years earlier
column3: Nielsen reported Tuesday.  In fact
column4: the only two inaugurations to draw more viewers were Ronald Reagan's first inaugural in 1981
column7: with 37. 8 million people watching.  Biden's 33. 8 million viewers easily topped Trump's 30. 6 million
column8: Nielsen said.  More people watched Trump's inauguration on Fox News
column9: though.  The network saw a 77 percent decline in viewers for Biden's ceremony versus Trump's.  CNN more than made up for the difference — its inaugural coverage was the No.  8 show in all of prime time last week
column10: Nielsen said.  In the cable wars
column11: CNN came in first last week
column12: followed by MSNBC and then Fox News.  Trump
column13: if he were bothered about getting lower ratings than Biden
column14: might take a little bit of solace in the fact that more people attended his inauguration in person four years ago.  More stories from theweek. comSarah Huckabee Sanders' shameless campaign for governorTrump's impeachment lawyer said he thinks 'the facts and the law will speak for themselves'Mitch McConnell is the GOAT#https://news.yahoo.com/bidens-inauguration-got-higher-tv-073035415.html#Pqg347cbc

column1: 2021-01-26 16:05:58#business#Apple Expected To Join The $100 Billion Revenue Club When Earnings Are Released#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-expected-join-100-billion-160558944.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/1bJ0XEW0_dDdiITgWSISWw--~B/aD00MDA7dz02MDA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/Benzinga/abe8bbcb2e09a84f764763c510ee2a34#en#0.29600000000000004#finance.yahoo.com#"Did someone say $100 billion? And then some? Wall Street analysts did.  A consensus sees Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) as joining that rarefied corporate crowd that’s broken the $100 billion in quarterly revenues mark when it opens the books Wednesday on its fiscal Q1.  That’s a record for AAPL
column2: of course
column3: and may have been assisted by holiday sales of its new iPhone 12.  But it’s one in a series of fresh peaks AAPL has scored in a year—one the company acknowledged was rocked by adversity in many corners.  Chief Financial Officer Luca Maestri said the strong results in last quarter’s report were driven by “the unmatched loyalty of our customers. ” That may or not be true
column4: but when AAPL reports earnings
column5: investors also will be listening to how well AAPL is playing the market share game.  The work-from-home trend
column7: looks like it might have been a game-changer for AAPL
column8: according to Morningstar analysts who believe it powered sales of iPads
column9: desktops
column10: and laptops.  All that could be overshadowed in fiscal Q1 by iPhone 12 holiday sales
column11: which it’s probably safe to say will get a fair share of attention Wednesday afternoon following the closing bell.  AAPL has always been an attention-getter when earnings season rolls around
column13: with it sporting a $2. 34 trillion market cap and reaching new stock price highs
column14: it looks like it’s sure to take a spot under the limelight even when it’s up against a host of other high-profile tech stocks earnings results this week.  Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) and Facebook
column15: Inc.  (NASDAQ: FB) report the same afternoon.  The Numbers Wall Street analysts expect AAPL revenue to jump 12% year-over-year to about $103 billion
column16: according to FactSet.  But some firms
column18: are looking for much stronger numbers: up 19% to $109. 5 billion.  From an earnings perspective
column19: the Street has reached a consensus of $1. 41 a share.  Morgan Stanley (NYSE: MS) is also forecasting on the high side of consensus
column20: eyeing revenues of $108. 2 billion and earnings per share of $1. 50.  “Our recent conversations suggest investors expect Apple to release solid
column23: ” Morgan Stanley analysts wrote in a recent report.  “We disagree and believe that Apple is likely to report all-time record quarterly revenue and earnings.  “In our view
column24: the iPhone 12 has been Apple’s most successful product launch in the last five years
column25: ” they said.  More on that later.  Any way you look at it
column26: the numbers look robust.  The Innovation Machine AAPL stopped giving guidance last year—kind of like many other companies uncertain of the ramifications of COVID-19 on their sales.  In March
column27: no one knew what the ricochet effects of the pandemic might be or how long it might last.  We still don’t know all of that
column28: but we have found that the city- and state-mandated quarantines and the overall fear of being in public helped fast-forward many trends that were already picking up steam.  The digital transformation sped up
column29: and it looks like AAPL might have been well-positioned for it.  While the iPhone 12 might get most of the attention Wednesday
column30: think back to last quarter when CEO Tim Cook noted all-time records for Mac and Services.  Though he didn’t offer guidance for this past quarter per se
column31: he did suggest double-digit gains on all product categories except the iPhone 12
column32: which he thought would reach single-digit gains.  FIGURE 1: APPLE LEAVES INDEX IN THE DUST.  Over the last year
column33: shares of Apple (AAPL—candlestick) have easily outpaced the Nasdaq-100 Index (NDX—purple line).  Apple shares got off to a quick start in 2021
column34: with investors apparently enthusiastic about tomorrow’s Q1 earnings prospects.  Data source: Nasdaq.  Chart source: The thinkorswim® platform from TD Ameritrade.  For illustrative purposes only.  Past performance does not guarantee future results.  The Mighty iPhone 5G Launch Despite all the happy talk about fiscal Q4 revenues
column35: iPhone’s weaker-than-expected sales offset the glee and pulled shares down nearly 6% in the first couple of days after the October earnings release.  They have since recovered.  AAPL reported iPhone sales of $26. 4 billion in fiscal Q4
column36: below the $27. 73 billion expected by the Street.  Much of that shortfall was attributed to AAPL’s decision to push the iPhone 12 launch into this most recent quarter
column37: a move many believe may have led to consumers waiting for the upgrade before they bought.  Back then
column38: some analysts said a move to 5G could end up being a tailwind for the iPhone 12 with sales promotions and subscription services bundles.  That
column39: combined with the important holiday shopping season about to begin
column40: could have led to a fast start for the new phone.  We’ll see now if they were right.  Analysts are mostly bullish on their iPhone sales expectations
column41: with some saying the delay might have pushed around $4 billion in iPhone sales to the December quarter from the fiscal Q3.  The Street’s consensus last stood at $59. 58 billion
column42: up better than 6% on a year-over-year basis.  But Loup Ventures thinks that’s conservative.  It’s looking for sales to vault 16% on a year-over-year basis to $64. 9 billion
column43: jumping to 59% of total sales compared with the iPhone’s typical 50% of sales standing.  It’s unclear if that will actually be the case
column44: but if it is it would reverse a trend in recent years toward iPhones being less of AAPL’s total revenue.  The company has been emphasizing growth in services.  Remember
column45: we’re just two years out from January 2019 when Cook sent a letter to AAPL investors warning of a fiscal Q1 earnings shortfall due in part to weak iPhone sales in China.  How things have changed.  AAPL Earnings And Options Activity AAPL is expected to report an adjusted EPS of $1. 41
column46: up from $1. 25 in the prior-year quarter
column47: according to third-party consensus analyst estimates.  Revenue is projected at $103. 01 billion
column48: up 16. 4% from a year ago.  The options market has priced in an expected share price move of 6. 2% in either direction around the earnings release
column49: according to the Market Maker Move™ indicator on the thinkorswim® platform.  Looking at the Jan.  29 options expiration
column50: puts have been active at the 125 and 135 strikes.  But it’s been dwarfed by activity to the upside
column51: heavy call volume at the 145 and 150 strikes.  The implied volatility sits at the 34th percentile as of Tuesday morning.  Note: Call options represent the right
column53: to buy the underlying security at a predetermined price over a set period of time.  Put options represent the right
column55: to sell the underlying security at a predetermined price over a set period of time.  Home Work And Its Tools The work- and study-from-home phenomenon helped drive sales of Macs and iPads last year
column56: and analysts widely expect that trend continued into the fiscal Q1.  A number of bells and whistles were added to new iPads and iPad Airs
column57: and new computers with AAPL’s custom M1 chip replacing the Intel Corporation (NASDAQ: INTC) chip also hit the market.  AAPL also is reportedly working on a new iPad Pro expected to be released in mid-March.  There’s also talk on Wall Street that AAPL might have patented a new version of the Magic Keyboard for the iPad Pro.  Given Cook’s comments about the “most prolific product introduction period
column58: ” analysts widely expect to hear about other new products coming on line.  An update of the MacBook Air is one of those possible developments.  AAPL is working on a thinner and lighter version of the MacBook Air
column60: citing “people with knowledge of the matter.  Analysts said they want to know if the planned release in the second half of this year is on track.  Analysts at Monness
column62: Hardt & Co.  expect AAPL to shed light on several new products and services
column63: including how sales are going for its $549 AirPods Max over-the-ear headphones and the subscription Apple Fitness+ offering
column64: plus ways to bundle services together for a discount.  “In our view
column65: Apple’s portfolio was positioned better-than-ever heading into the recent holiday season
column66: while product and service updates position Planet Apple well in 2021
column67: ” the team wrote.  And So Much More Among the myriad reasons AAPL’s earnings are such a magnet goes beyond products Other factors underscoring the company’s progress range from privacy concerns to app developer fees to government interventions and the overall economy.  AAPL has done much to address many of these issues
column68: but each quarter tends to introduce a fresh crop.  In November
column70: AAPL said it would cut in half the commissions it charges smaller developers who sell software through the App Store and generate under $1 million in sales.  AAPL’s original 30% take has long fueled complaints from developers
column71: users and governments over its dominance in the digital world.  The price cut to 15% appeased some but not all stakeholders and analysts hope the company will address how the cuts are panning out in the beginning weeks.  Another question heading into earnings is AAPL’s cash position.  The total cash trove stood at roughly $192 billion at the end of the company’s fiscal Q4
column72: with about $112 billion in debt and a little more than $79 billion in cash.  AAPL returned nearly $22 billion to shareholders in the form of buybacks and dividends.  Investors can expect to continue to see more of that ahead
column74: which estimates an additional $73 billion will be returned in coming years.  TD Ameritrade® commentary for educational purposes only.  Member SIPC. column1: 2021-01-26 17:08:03#tech#Now you can play The Elder Scrolls in an Elder Scrolls chair
column2: wearing your Elder Scrolls ring#https://www.pcgamer.com/now-you-can-play-the-elder-scrolls-in-an-elder-scrolls-chair-wearing-your-elder-scrolls-ring/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/R23joDnAoYiMSi8jPbFLGX-1200-80.png#en#0.34#www.pcgamer.com#"The Elder Scrolls games take place in the world of Tamriel
column3: and key to this universe is chairs.  Just you try caning Skyrim from a standing position.  In a rather obvious brand tie-up
column4: there is now an Elder Scrolls Online-themed chair coming from Noblechairs
column5: a company whose sedentary solutions apparently ""combine the latest ergonomics and sports-inspired design. ""(To be fair
column6: it does look a bit sportier than this unfortunate customer.  We're still waiting to find out the reason behind the Twitch ban. )What is there to say about a chair? Perhaps now is the time to invoke the theory of forms
column8: even if all the chairs in the world were to be destroyed
column9: there would still remain an inviolable
column10: timeless idea of the chair in the human mind.  All objects are mere imitations of this ideal chair.  Who is to say that this The Elder Scrolls Online is not very close to that essence
column11: that soul of a chair?The chair is based on Noblechairs' existing HERO model
column12: which we reckon is the best gaming chair around for back support.  This design is ""now merged with premium grade black and gold PU leather
column13: gold stitching and high-detail embroidered artwork"" (PU or polyurethane leather is an artificial leather). You can sign up here to be notified when the chair is available.  No price is listed
column14: but the chair type is the modestly-named HERO which usually clocks in at around $500 (as it did for an old Fallout tie-in).  Next to an Elder Scrolls wedding ring that costs a cool grand

column1: 2021-01-25 22:50:03#tech#Apple Plans Thinner MacBook Air With Magnetic Charger in Mac Lineup Reboot#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-plans-thinner-macbook-air-110053086.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/s8WY0nQd3.27fgIxApm28A--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTIwMDA7aD0xNTAw/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/woTwQXluvX9Pf126hxl4qw--~B/aD0yMDAwO3c9MjY2NzthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_technology_68/87d5b098a337fdb40e29f066afeced46#en#0.0#finance.yahoo.com#(Bloomberg) -- Apple Inc.  is working on a thinner and lighter version of the MacBook Air
column2: the company’s mass-market laptop
column3: according to people with knowledge of the matter.  The new computer is planned to be released during the second half of this year at the earliest or in 2022.  It will include Apple’s MagSafe charging technology and a next-generation version of the company’s in-house Mac processors.  Apple has discussed making the laptop smaller by shrinking the border around the screen
column4: which will remain 13-inches.  The current model weighs 2. 8 pounds and is just over half an inch at its thickest point.  The company considered building a larger version of the MacBook Air with a 15-inch screen
column5: but Apple isn’t moving forward with this for the next generation
column7: who asked not to be identified discussing private matters.  An Apple spokeswoman declined to comment. MagSafe
column8: which was removed from the MacBook Air with its 2018 redesign
column9: is a magnetic charging system.  That means any accidental yanking of the power cable would simply detach it from the laptop rather than pull down the entire computer.  The new model will have a pair of USB 4 ports for connecting external devices.  The new laptop is destined to be a higher-end version of the current MacBook Air
column10: which is expected to remain in the company’s lineup as an entry-level offering.  Apple last updated the product in November with its own M1 Mac chip
column11: replacing a processor from Intel Corp.  The Mac is Apple’s oldest product line and has a loyal following.  A few years ago
column12: the company was criticized for not updating these computers enough and not paying attention to customer demands.  Now
column13: there’s a flood of updates coming.  In addition to the new MacBook Air
column14: Apple is planning its biggest update to the MacBook Pro since 2016
column15: the first redesign of the iMac in nearly a decade
column17: and a half-sized Mac Pro desktop with in-house chips. The upcoming MacBook Pro is an example of Apple’s renewed focus on Mac loyalists.  The company is planning to bring back an SD card slot for the next MacBook Pros so users can insert memory cards from digital cameras.  That feature was removed in 2016
column18: to the consternation of professional photographers and video creators
column19: key segments of the MacBook Pro user base.  The heavily criticized Touch Bar
column20: the current model’s touchscreen function row
column21: is also going.  Apple has also developed underlying Mac support for both cellular connectivity — the ability for Macs to connect to the internet via smartphone networks — and Face ID
column22: the company’s facial recognition system.  But neither feature appears to be coming soon.  To that end
column23: Face ID had originally been planned to arrive in this year’s iMac redesign
column24: but it’s now unlikely to be included in the first iteration of the new design.  (367487164)For more articles like this
column25: please visit us at bloomberg. comSubscribe now to stay ahead with the most trusted business news source. ©2021 Bloomberg L. P. #https://finance.yahoo.com/news/apple-plans-thinner-macbook-air-110053086.html#iIlMxEg6t

column2: BMW Approved for Slice of $3.5 Billion EU Battery Aid#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tesla-bmw-approved-slice-3-134013171.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/F_o7xdbFbCeYM1V1SsTreQ--~B/aD0xMzM0O3c9MjAwMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_markets_842/96b09f9a622d3139018f9022cf360dd0#en#0.4215#finance.yahoo.com#(Bloomberg) -- The European Union paved the way for companies including Tesla Inc.  and BMW AG to get about 2. 9 billion euros ($3. 5 billion) of state aid for battery projects that will strengthen the bloc’s position in the race to produce more electric vehicles. The European Commission expects the support to trigger more than three times as much private investment
column3: bringing the total spent to about 12 billion euros.  The aid will go to 42 companies across a dozen countries
column4: with beneficiaries also including Fiat Chrysler owner Stellantis NV and startup Northvolt AB. The 27-nation bloc plans to slash greenhouse gas emissions from transport under the European Green Deal
column5: an ambitious economic overhaul aimed at reaching climate neutrality by 2050.  Along the way
column6: the EU wants to reduce its reliance on EV batteries from Asian producers.  The value of Europe’s battery market will reach 250 billion euros by 2025 and meet demands from the auto industry
column7: according to the commission. “Europe will cement in this way its position as a global hot spot for battery investment
column8: ” European Commission Vice President Maros Sefcovic said.  “This pan-European project will help revolutionize the battery market. ”More information about the amount of aid going to each project will be available in the public version of the Commission’s decision once it has agreed with member states and third parties on any confidential business secrets that need to be removed. Aid for the projects
column9: which are expected to be completed by 2028
column10: will be disbursed by countries including Finland
column11: Spain
column13: and was coordinated by Germany.  It follows a 3. 2 billion-euro package to support a total of 9 billion euros of public and private spending that was coordinated by France and approved in December 2019. Pouring InBattery investment has poured in as Europe’s stricter pollution standards forces carmakers to embrace electric cars and limit carbon-dioxide emissions.  BloombergNEF is forecasting 1. 9 million sales of plug-in hybrid and battery-electric vehicles in Europe this year
column14: topping China and almost quadrupling the total expected in North America. As part of the Green Deal
column15: the EU wants to toughen its 2030 emissions-reduction target to at least 55% from 1990 levels
column16: compared with the existing goal of a 40% cut.  The overhaul is a key pillar of the region’s strategy to recover from the virus-induced recession. European policy makers are aware the bloc’s key industries risk falling behind if they don’t fill manufacturing gaps in energy-storage technology.  Lithium-ion batteries will power plug-in cars and also help balance electric grids transmitting renewable energy including wind and solar. The battery initiative announced Tuesday got priority status as an Important Project of Common European Interest
column17: or IPCEI.  It will involve research and development of new technologies to reduce or completely eliminate cobalt or natural graphite and replace it with synthetics. The projects will cover the entire battery value chain
column19: design and manufacturing of battery cells and packs
column20: and recycling and disposal.  The aid is expected to contribute to development of technological breakthroughs
column22: novel production processes and other innovations. Tesla’s AmbitionsTesla Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk has said the electric-car maker plans to add a battery-cell production facility at the vehicle-assembly plant it’s building near Berlin.  The site will initially have capacity of more than 100 gigawatt-hours a year and eventually ramp up to as much as 250 gigawatt-hours
column23: Musk said during a battery conference in November. “I’m pretty confident at that point it would be the largest battery-cell plant in the world
column24: ” Musk said.  He didn’t give time frames for when he expects the facility to reach those capacity levels. The factory Tesla is building in the small town of Gruenheide will be the company’s first in Europe.  It’s slated to start making vehicle in the middle of this year and eventually assemble as many as 500
column25: 000 cars annually.  While construction is far along
column26: the company is still awaiting final approval for the project from local authorities.  It also has been hung up by environmental groups’ legal challenges. Other carmakers investing in European battery production include PSA Group
column27: which merged with Fiat Chrysler to form Stellantis.  It set up a joint venture called Automotive Cells Company with French oil giant Total SA’s Saft unit in September.  Sweden’s Northvolt will operate a plant with Volkswagen AG in Germany
column28: with BMW also participating in the project and ordering billions’ worth of batteries from the startup. Asian battery giants including South Korea’s LG Chem Ltd.
column29: Japan’s Panasonic Corp.  and China’s Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.  Ltd.  also have said they’re going to set up or expand operations in the region. (Updates to add that the amount of aid per project is being released later in the fifth paragraph. )For more articles like this

column2: Insane
column3: And Dangerous'#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/gamestop-investor-michael-burry-big-041451224.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/rDgocFI6j6VwE5iRppuwHg--~B/aD00MDA7dz02MDA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/Benzinga/7ecf3507e611483b221100253f7f00e6#en#-0.4404#finance.yahoo.com#Scion Capital founder Michael Burry on Tuesday criticized investors that have concerted to fuel a rally in the shares of game retailer GameStop Corporation (NYSE: GME).  What Happened: The hedge fund manager aired his displeasure at the short squeeze on Twitter.  If I put $GME on your radar
column4: and you did well
column5: I’m genuinely happy for you.  However
column6: what is going on now – there should be legal and regulatory repercussions.  This is unnatural
column8: and dangerous.  @SEC_Enforcement — Cassandra (@michaeljburry) January 27
column9: 2021 Burry also tagged the Securities and Exchange Commission’s enforcement arm in his Twitter post.  The physician-investor is known for “The Big Short
column10: ” a film in which he was played by Christian Bale.  The movie is based on his bet against the US housing market.  Why It Matters: Burry owned 1. 7 million GameStop shares worth $17 million at the end of September
column11: reported Business Insider.  The shares would be now worth $250 million
column13: 400% increase
column14: as of Tuesday’s close.  GameStop shares surged over 41. 5% in the after-hours session after Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) CEO Elon Musk tweeted “Gamestonk!!” on Tuesday.  Musk also included a link to the Reddit forum r/WallStreetBets that has pushed the retailer’s shares higher and put pressure on short sellers.  See Also: GameStop's Power Surge: Will WallStreetBets Or The Short Sellers Come Out On Top? As of Tuesday’s closing
column15: GameStop shares have returned 678. 84% since the beginning of the year
column16: Price Action: GameStop shares closed 92. 71% at $147. 98 on Tuesday and spiked 41. 58% in the after-hours session to $209. 51. 2021-01-25 14:57:00#local#Inadequate immune responses force Merck to abandon COVID-19 vaccines#https://news.yahoo.com/inadequate-immune-responses-force-merck-145700051.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/OpeQssbksVIYBW.YH6bsMA--~B/aD01NjA7dz04NDA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/the_week_574/26c5dfe9b57bd3ec3075d3c3687e5449#en#-0.5267#news.yahoo.com#Merck
column2: one of the world's most storied vaccine makers
column3: is abandoning the development of its two COVID-19 vaccines after initial trials resulted in inadequate immune responses
column4: Stat News reports.  Both vaccines produced lower levels of coronavirus antibodies than have been found in the blood of individuals who recovered from natural COVID-19 infections.  For reference
column5: the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines produced antibody levels several times higher than natural infections. The unsuccessful trials are disappointing in large part because both Merck vaccines would have required just one dose
column6: writes Stat.  One of the candidates
column7: which uses the same virus as the one in Merck's successful Ebola vaccine
column8: was being developed in partnership with the International AIDS Vaccine Initiative
column9: which has said it will try to determine if using an oral or intranasal administration route will work better than the current intramuscular injection.  It's unclear if Merck will continue to collaborate — IAVI's president Mark Feinberg told Stat he hopes they do — because the pharmaceutical company has suggested it will now turn its focus to developing COVID-19 therapeutics. As Stat notes
column10: the results show just how difficult vaccine development can be
column11: especially in such a short amount of time
column12: making the rapid success of the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna shots seem all the more remarkable.  Read more at Stat News. More stories from theweek. com Democrats are getting Chuck Grassleyed Biden did not
column13: in fact
column14: remove Trump's 'Diet Coke button' from the Resolute Desk
column15: White House clarifies Josh Hawley knows exactly what he's doing#https://news.yahoo.com/inadequate-immune-responses-force-merck-145700051.html#sxhkW7t6D

column2: catapulting the former small cap’s market value beyond 14 members of the S&P 500 including Alaska Air Group Inc.  and Marathon Oil Corp. The stock climbed as much as 32% at the open on Tuesday
column3: putting its market capitalization at about $7 billion and making GameStop worth more than the likes of Perrigo Co.
column4: Apache Corp.
column6: and Hanesbrands Inc.  It surpassed insurance-provider Unum Group
column8: and Flowserve Corp.  on Monday. The video-game retailer has climbed about 400% this year with traders piling into the stock after activist investor and Chewy Inc.  co-founder Ryan Cohen joined its board earlier this month.  Options trading has also surged with retail investors ramping up bets on even more upside. The stock’s surge has in part been fueled by an army of Reddit-charged day traders who used the website’s WallStreetBets forum to pump up shares and fight back against the eye-popping levels of short interest.  Bets by Gabe Plotkin’s Melvin Capital and Andrew Left’s Citron Research have faced a reckoning in the battle with GameStop’s retail fans. Hedge fund titans Ken Griffin and Steve Cohen boosted Melvin Capital
column9: according to a statement on Monday

2021-01-25 21:41:44#tech#The state of Fortnite in 2021#https://www.pcgamer.com/the-state-of-fortnite-in-2021/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/QYQU6eWpWqZtpf2BpQDxha-1200-80.jpg#en#0.0#www.pcgamer.com#"Fortnite is barely three years old.  For all the transformation still undergoing Fortnite
column2: 2017 feels like too small a distance for a game to have gone from rumored vaporware to global phenomenon.  I scored the earliest version of Fortnite a 55 at the time
column3: a clearly troubled project that Epic Games just needed to get out after spinning its wheels in development purgatory.  Fortnite would either take on new life in the hands of players or fizzle out and die of natural causes.  It happens.  But just as the battle royale craze spun up in the wake of PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds' surprise success
column4: Epic pulled an historic U-turn and put out Fortnite: Battle Royale
column5: then a simple spin-off developed in three months.  Over time Fortnite's improvisational development helped establish a modern vocabulary for live games with in-game events
column7: and consistent seasonal cycles.  Fortnite saw the rise of Ninja and mainstream Twitch celebrity at large
column8: it saw Epic try out bonkers marketing stunts like the complete shutdown of Fortnite for a few days just to generate awareness and usher in Chapter 2.  Fortnite became such a cultural
column9: money-printing force that Epic went as far as to abandon the iOS platform as a form of protest over ""monopolistic practices
column10: even accompanying the move with a parody of Apple's own 1984-inspired Macintosh ad.  And now
column13: still making stuff up on the fly
column14: but it's settled into a more comfortable rhythm.  Fortnite is a battle royale toy box without a bottom
column15: and with every recognizable character and brand waiting for their turn in the item shop.  Even if you've played before
column16: look away for a second and Fortnite will take on a totally new look when you turn back.  So let's take a look at the state of Fortnite in 2021 and try to guess how this megagame might transform further. "#https://www.pcgamer.com/the-state-of-fortnite-in-2021/#SDAkTnn1r

column1: 2021-01-25 18:58:21#tech#Annie Murphy Is Auctioning Off Her First Red Carpet Dress For Charity - Here's How to Bid#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/annie-murphy-auctioning-off-her-212111527.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/SPLsewahDNVbOQRCkU.UKg--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTIwMDA7aD0zMDE2/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/l_tDxvlSDdhplWLVWeB.iA--~B/aD0zMDg4O3c9MjA0ODthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/popsugar_fashion_831/cbb41948bcacef4d2570705adf7e5b61#en#0.4215#www.yahoo.com#"Grab your diamonds and prepare to strut like a goddess in front of your exes because Annie Murphy is auctioning off the designer dress from her first red carpet appearance
column2: and it is dazzling.  The Schitt's Creek star shared her plans to sell the dress to the highest bidder on Jan.  21
column3: and noted that 100 percent of proceeds will go to charity.  ""This was the very first thing I wore on my very first red carpet (the Canadian Screen Awards in 2015) so yeah
column4: there might be anxiety sweat in the armpits
column5: but there are pockets in the dress
column7: she captioned an Instagram post.  ""I would very much like to sell it to you if you're in the market. "" The proceeds from the dress will be evenly split between two charities
column8: including Encampment Support Network
column9: a volunteer-run network that helps individuals living in tent encampments across Toronto.  Murphy will enlist the help of her followers to choose the second charity (Canadian or American) to support.  As a seasoned trend setter
column10: Murphy knows that we shop with our eyes
column11: but she threw in a few key details about the dress to make it even more appealing to potential bidders.  Highlights of the elegant gown include: ""It's black. "" ""It has pockets. "" ""It's made by evening wear brand Wayne Clark Designs. "" ""It is sweaty in and around the armpit area. "" ""It's a size 4. "" ""There's a big ol 'v' in the front so your skin can pop out of there. "" ""It's very nice. "" Interested in expanding your wardrobe to reflect a little more of the true style icon behind Alexis Rose? Anyone willing to donate a sizeable amount to charity can email Murphy at csadress69@gmail. com.  She'll only respond to the highest bidders
column12: so this might be the time to gather up the gang and have everyone chip in on the most squeal-worthy of dresses
column13: as Alexis might say.  Take a closer look at Murphy's evening gown from the 2015 Canadian Screen Awards here. column1: 2021-01-25 22:43:22#tech#Dragon Age 4 will be set in Tevinter#https://www.pcgamer.com/dragon-age-4-will-be-set-in-tevinter/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/Mu8eFCYCD2gvjEkSbe5pcH-1200-80.jpg#en#0.0#www.pcgamer.com#"We were already pretty sure that Dragon Age 4 will be set in the previously unseen realm of Tevinter.  The Inquisitor stabs a knife directly into a map of the Tevinter Imperium at the end of the Dragon Age: Inquisition DLC Trespasser
column2: for one thing
column3: and BioWare pointed a finger in the same direction in 2020 with the release of a collection of short stories called Tevinter Nights. The writing's been on the wall.  But now
column4: it's in an actual licensed book.  Any doubts about the location of the new game have been dispelled by the recently released BioWare: Stories and Secrets from 25 Years of Game Development
column5: a book celebrating the studio's 25th anniversary with art
column8: and stories.  Tom Phillips of Eurogamer scored himself a copy
column9: and found an official confirmation inside. ""As BioWare entered its twenty-fifth year
column10: the Dragon Age team was hard at work on Morrison
column11: the code name of the long-awaited follow-up to Dragon Age: Inquisition
column12: an entry on page 324 called ""Tevinter Bound: A sneak peek at the follow-up to Inquisition"" states. ""The game
column13: helmed by executive producer Mark Darrah
column14: will take players to Tevinter as the events of Inquisition and Trespasser threaten to forever change Thedas. """#https://www.pcgamer.com/dragon-age-4-will-be-set-in-tevinter/#nHiXqdyZn

2021-01-25 08:21:47#business#Tencent’s $251 Billion Rally Triggers Frenzy in Shares
column2: Options#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tencent-232-billion-rally-triggers-053827749.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/SrWguoPOgLzBayFVPjAewA--~B/aD02NzU7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_technology_68/90eba54bae8071b470fe803fa7ec109a#en#-0.0258#finance.yahoo.com#(Bloomberg) -- Hong Kong’s equity traders can’t get enough of Tencent Holdings Ltd.
column3: the $950 billion giant that’s on pace for its biggest ever monthly gain. They’re paying up for bullish derivatives tracking the Chinese internet firm
column4: buying thousands of January call options that expire Thursday.  The price of one Tencent contract -- which bets the stock will rise past HK$800 by expiry -- surged as much as 118
column5: 300% on Monday.  Traders also rushed to offload their bearish puts
column6: with one of the most-traded contracts losing more than 84% in value. The stock rallied 11% on Monday to HK$766. 50
column7: its biggest gain since October 2011.  Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index benchmark rose 2. 4%
column8: closing above the key 30
column9: 000 point-level for the first time since May 2019. Tencent has become a prime target for mainland traders flooding record amounts of cash into Hong Kong-listed shares this year
column10: with net purchase of the stock accounting for roughly a quarter of total money coming in
column11: according to exchange data.  The buying frenzy has also boosted Tencent’s market value by about $251 billion this year
column13: according to data compiled by Bloomberg.  Tesla Inc.  is the second-largest gainer
column14: up $134 billion. Tencent shares now trade at nearly 40 times analysts’ estimated earnings for the next 12 months.  While that’s well above the average of 30 since Bloomberg began tracking the data in 2005
column15: it’s still below the recent peak multiple of 42 reached in 2014 and 2018.  It reached 65 at the height of China’s equity bubble in 2007. On Monday
column16: analysts at Citigroup Inc.  lifted their target price on the firm by 19% to HK$876
column17: the highest among analysts tracked by Bloomberg
column18: citing the company’s market-share expansion and growth in the gaming sector and other digital businesses. Tencent is also getting an additional boost from taking part in the city’s fast-growing initial public offering market.  Kuaishou Technology
column20: is seeking to raise as much as $5. 4 billion in Hong Kong in what would be the biggest internet IPO since Uber Technologies Inc. With the recent run-up
column21: Tencent is trading at its highest price on record.  It’s largely avoided the tightening regulatory oversight that sparked a selloff in rival Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.  and forced its part-owned Ant Group Co.  to jettison a record IPO. For more articles like this
column22: please visit us at bloomberg. comSubscribe now to stay ahead with the most trusted business news source. ©2021 Bloomberg L. P. #https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tencent-232-billion-rally-triggers-053827749.html#Pu8pHZYaU

column1: 2021-01-24 20:55:20#tech#The Hitman 3 Dubai speedrun record? 9 seconds#https://www.pcgamer.com/the-hitman-3-dubai-speedrun-record-9-seconds/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/MCFjmXm4XgZvi2SJMvwGEf-1200-80.jpg#en#0.0#www.pcgamer.com#There are two speedrunners who are on top of the world right now
column2: and by that I mean literally the Hitman 3 level On Top of the World
column3: the game's first level
column4: which Any% speedrunners have completed in a truly shocking nine (9) seconds.  The secret? Run forward and shoot your gun. Speedrunner Wreak finished the level in 9 seconds on January 22nd
column5: followed by Der_Lauch_Linus on the 23rd.  The speedy completion is due to the level's funky architecture.  The Dubai level takes place on the top floors of a skyscraper
column6: and in the moments after the start of the level both targets are visible on balconies above Agent 47's starting point.  So you move quick
column8: and shoot them both in seconds.  You can watch Wreak's record run here and Der_Lauch_Linus' record here.  Bonus points to Wreak for wearing a sillier costume than Linus.  These are Any% runs
column9: which means that they simply have to complete the objectives by Speedrun. com's rules. It's not clear if you can do it in 8 seconds.  There are crucial milliseconds where Wreak or Linus are lining up their shots.  I'll bet you someone is already trying.  Meanwhile
column10: the Silent Assassin run record is only a measly 7 seconds longer. #https://www.pcgamer.com/the-hitman-3-dubai-speedrun-record-9-seconds/#QkvPEvOyy

column4: smart
column5: sane journalism.  Sign up for Axios Newsletters here. Driving the news: Israeli officials said the call was meant mainly as an introduction and to kick off the dialogue.  They added that one of the issues discussed was Iran.  * In recent days
column6: Sullivan made calls to his counterparts in the U. K.
column8: Germany
column9: Japan and South Korea.  * The White House did not comment on the call with the Israeli national security adviser. The big picture: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is concerned about President Biden's stated goal of trying to resume the nuclear deal with Iran.  Such a move could result in tensions between the Biden administration and the Israeli government.  * Secretary of State designate Tony Blinken said at his confirmation hearing this week that ""there is a long way"" until the Iran deal could be resumed.  * He stressed that the U. column1: 2021-01-23 16:34:58#world#Hodgepodge systems
column2: confusion mar California vaccine rollout#https://www.sfchronicle.com/news/article/Hodgepodge-systems-confusion-mar-California-15892717.php#https://s.hdnux.com/photos/01/16/23/55/20527997/41/rawImage.jpg#en#-0.29600000000000004#www.sfchronicle.com#SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — More than five weeks into its vaccination program
column3: California doesn't have nearly the supply to meet demand and there's growing angst among residents over the difficulty to even get in line for a shot.  Social media is awash with people seeking or giving tips on how to maneuver the system.  State officials are frustrated the federal government hasn't provided more doses.  Local officials are upset Gov.  Gavin Newsom last week suddenly added the 4 million residents between ages 65 and 74 to what was supposed to be a shorter list of people first in line for shots
column4: including health care workers and those in nursing care facilities.  Adding to the confusion is a hodgepodge of systems and differing requirements in the state's 58 counties.  For example
column5: Los Angeles and Orange counties authorized mass vaccination sites like Dodger Stadium and Disneyland to give shots to those over 65
column6: while San Francisco is relying largely on hospital systems to vaccinate only patients 75 and up.  Some counties are vaccinating first responders
column8: while others are finishing up health care workers before moving to other groups.  The variety of approaches invariably means
column9: for example
column10: envious seniors in one part of the state are left wondering when it’s their turn as they see video of others getting shots.  Those include 73-year-old former Gov.  Arnold Schwarzenegger
column11: who touted his inoculation at Dodger Stadium this week with a famous line from his Terminator films: “Come with me if you want to live. ” Another senior citizen
column13: had a frustrating week trying to get shots for himself and his wife.  He had noticed long lines snaking outside the nonprofit Asian Health Services and ran into a neighbor on Wednesday who said she had received vaccine there.  He asked for the. . . #https://www.sfchronicle.com/news/article/Hodgepodge-systems-confusion-mar-California-15892717.php#noMhsia6Z

China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Group
column3: the developer's Hong Kong-listed unit
column4: is raising HK$26 billion (US$3. 35 billion) selling 952. 4 million new shares at HK$27. 30 each
column5: according to a Hong Kong stock exchange filing on Sunday.  The price represents a 9 per cent discount to the last traded level on Friday
column6: and the stake amounts to about 9. 75 per cent of its enlarged capital. Some of the richest Hong Kong and mainland tycoons have agreed to subscribe for the shares
column7: the company said.  They include Chan Hoi-wan of developer Chinese Estate Holdings and spouse of Joseph Lau Luen-hung
column8: as well as Liu Ming-hui
column9: the founder of China Gas Holdings.  Each will buy HK$3 billion of stake.  The buyers have agreed to a 12-month lock-up on their shares. Get the latest insights and analysis from our Global Impact newsletter on the big stories originating in China. The stock placement shows the investors' confidence in the business prospects and can also strengthen its capital base
column10: according to the company's filing.  It will help the Group's strategic goal of becoming ""the world's largest and most powerful new energy vehicle group
column11: it added. Chinese EV makers like NIO
column13: and Li Auto are rushing to catch an expected upswing in demand as China's economic rebound gains traction after growth quickened to a pre-pandemic pace of more than 6 per cent last quarter.  China is also set to become the world's biggest market for EV when 4 million cars
column14: or one in every five vehicles
column15: will be powered by electricity by 2025. The race to the market is preceded by a rush to build a war chest of capital.  China Evergrande NEV earlier sold 176. 6 million of new shares in September for about HK$4 billion
column16: or HK$22. 65 each.  Earlier this month
column17: NIO raised about US$1. 3 billion from the sale of convertible bonds
column18: while Xpeng got US$1. 98 billion of credit lines from five mainland banking groups.  Last week
column19: BYD announced a stock placement to raise US$3. 9 billon. China Evergrande NEV is controlled by the country's third richest tycoon Hui Ka-yan.  His plan is to raise its car production capacity to 500
column20: 000 to 1 million vehicles within three to five years
column21: the company said on its website.  Its plants in Shanghai and Guangzhou will be capable of rolling out 200
column22: 000 units a year each at the beginning
column23: before reaching 1 million by the fifth year
column24: it added. The company's shares have risen 307 per cent over the past 12 months
column25: giving it a market value of about US$34 billion despite incurring huge losses over the past two years.  The other four investors who have agreed to take up HK$5 billion each in the stock placement include businessmen from its home base Shenzhen. China Evergrande NEV intends to spend the money on technology research and development
column26: production of new energy vehicle business and repay older debt

column1: 2021-01-24 13:11:58#health#The CDC Is Requiring You to Do This Starting Tuesday#https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/cdc-requiring-starting-tuesday-131158219.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/FtjYRYGFRR5_5HXvshZQyQ--~B/aD04MDA7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en/best_life_342/5ae6d9b2705928f41efba309c0527e30#en#0.0#www.yahoo.com#"As we enter the second year of the global pandemic
column2: we've grown accustomed to certain changes in our daily lives.  Dining in a restaurant might involve a tent and heat lamps
column3: doctors appointments are conducted via telemedicine apps
column4: and gone are the days of meandering your way through a mall.  Now
column5: the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has one more addition to the growing list of lifestyle changes: Staring Tuesday
column6: you'll be required to provide evidence of a negative COVID test before flying back to the U. S.  from any international destination. ""If you plan to travel internationally
column7: you will need to get tested no more than 3 days before you travel by air into the United States (US) and show your negative result to the airline before you board your flight
column8: or be prepared to show documentation of recovery
column9: reads the new policy
column10: which was posted to the CDC's website on Jan.  23. As the new policy mandates
column11: airlines must refuse to board anyone who fails to provide a negative COVID test result.  This could very well disrupt travel plans for some
column12: but should help to minimize potential exposure for those flying
column13: as well as the broader public. According to David Cutler
column14: MD
column15: a family medicine physician at Providence Saint John's Health Center in Santa Monica
column17: the CDC's new policy has arrived not a moment too soon.  As he explains
column18: the ""recently increased ability of COVID to pass from person to person is making air travel and all activities more risky for contracting this disease. ""Longer flights already pose a risk that experts say is incalculable at this time.  Anthony Fauci
column20: director of the National Institute for Allergy and Infectious Disease (NIAID)
column21: said in a recent interview that shorter flights may be safe due to HEPA filter use for ""modest duration flights
column24: ""all bets are off. ""It is impossible to say how safe airline travel might be
column25: agrees Cutler.  ""It is important to recognize that anyone around you could transmit COVID to you.  And you could pass it on to others. ""If you must fly
column26: read on for some expert-approved tips on how to do it as safely as possible.  And for the masks you shouldn't wear while flying or in any other situation
column27: check out The CDC Warns Against Using These 6 Face Masks.  1 Skip the flight if you have symptoms.  Just because you get a negative test doesn't necessarily mean you're in the clear.  If you present with any of the typical COVID symptoms
column28: you should seriously consider postponing your flight—even if your test has not confirmed your case. According to the MD Anderson Center at the University of Texas
column29: rapid antigen tests are less accurate than PCR tests at spotting the virus.  And while the CDC doesn't require any particular test type
column30: the three-day window will mean most travelers will use rapid tests
column31: which can deliver results in as little as a half an hour
column32: rather than the two to five days that it takes to get PCR test results. ""To a certain degree
column33: you're sacrificing accuracy with speed.  By their very nature
column34: the antigen style tests aren't as sensitive because they require a larger amount of virus present to be positive
column35: explains the MD Anderson website.  ""Someone with a positive test by this style of test should be treated as infected with COVID-19
column36: but a negative test is less reliable and may need to be confirmed. "" And for more regular COVID updates
column37: sign up for our daily newsletter.  2 Be vigilant before you board.  According to Cutler
column38: the risk of flying isn't limited to your flight time.  ""The risk of air travel also includes the risks of transport to the airport
column39: along with the time spent navigating airport lines and crowds
column40: he says. ""It is impossible to measure the risk you may be exposed to in these crowded
column41: uncontrolled environments.  That is why travel causes transmission of COVID and why one of the first steps in controlling the pandemic was limiting travel in those countries which effectively reduced the number of cases and deaths
column42: Cutler explains.  And for more on how COVID is spreading
column43: see why You're More Likely to Get COVID From Someone Doing This Than From Coughing.  3 Take precautions while using the airport bathroom.  Cutler also suggests exercising additional caution if you need to use the restroom while in the airport or aboard your flight.  These are high-traffic areas that often have questionable ventilation
column44: and while most airports have stepped up their cleaning regimens amid the pandemic
column45: bathrooms can still pose a heightened threat to travelers. If you do use the bathroom facilities
column46: be sure to wear your mask
column47: limit what you touch by using clean paper towels to operate faucets and doors
column48: and wash and sanitize your hands thoroughly afterward.  And for one thing you don't have to do anymore
column49: check out The One Thing You Can Stop Doing to Avoid COVID
column50: CDC Says.  4 Wear a medical grade mask and face shield.  While on board your flight
column51: Cutler explains that your main concern should be mitigating risk from those seated nearest to you.  ""The ventilation systems on commercial airliners contain HEPA air filters which effectively remove nearly any viral particles
column52: Cutler explains.  ""Several small studies have confirmed that the majority of the risk while flying comes from the people immediately around you. ""Luckily
column53: you can slash that risk by coming prepared with the right gear
column54: and by optimizing ventilation.  ""That risk can be minimized by wearing an N95 mask and face shield.  You should also turn your overhead air blower on high to push as much clean air at you as possible
column55: Cutler advises.  And for more on mask safety
column56: know that If You're Still Doing This

column1: 2021-01-23 19:43:46#tech#Genshin Impact 1.3 comes in February
column2: but an adorable slime festival is out now#https://www.pcgamer.com/genshin-impact-13-comes-in-february-but-an-adorable-slime-festival-is-out-now/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/bTFxwPiK2ChUBLiVMztrjD-1200-80.png#en#0.8625#www.pcgamer.com#Genshin Impact will be kicking off the Lunar New Year in style
column3: with a lantern festival coming to Liyue in February.  The 1. 3 update will release on February 3rd
column4: and is split into four events: All That Glitters
column7: and the Xiao Market.  Theater Mechanicus is a tower defense battle where players use a gridded arena to place down towers
column8: then fight alongside them against enemy waves.  The new character Xiao
column9: a 5-star
column10: is at the center of much of the update trailer and will receive a story quest to go with him.  Players will get a raftload of free materials in the update
column11: like rate-up wishes and a mini-event that gives out a free 4-star character from the Liyue crew: Xiangling
column13: Beidou
column14: Ningguang
column16: and Chongyun.  There's also an event coming based on the in-game photo mode
column17: with rewards for well-composed shots.  The other mini-events are a mode based around Geovishap mini-bosses and a Geovishap world boss
column18: and a Ley Line update that gives double loot for the first three Ley Lines each day. Additionally
column19: starting now and lasting until the end of January
column20: an online slime festival game lets you get some bonuses in Genshin proper by making slimes happy.  It's adorable—you can find those details here. We considered Genshin Impact
column21: a free-to-play open world RPG out of China
column22: to be one of 2020's biggest and most pleasant gaming surprises.  The new update will also include some fixes for the resin problem.  You can watch the full English livestream of the update reveal below. #https://www.pcgamer.com/genshin-impact-13-comes-in-february-but-an-adorable-slime-festival-is-out-now/#ToGuSi8MZ

column2: carrying a record-breaking number of satellites#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/watch-spacex-launch-first-dedicated-141102174.html#https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/s.o_X6wSBVsHBN9lrG2jZg--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTIwMDA7aD0xMzMz/https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/esKTjyHMniBmUttm16JtMw--~B/aD0yMDAwO3c9MzAwMDthcHBpZD15dGFjaHlvbg--/https://media.zenfs.com/en/techcrunch_350/663f4effcbea7f93124a74ca46395f8d#en#0.5106#finance.yahoo.com#SpaceX is set to launch the very first of its dedicated rideshare missions – an offering it introduced in 2019 that allows small satellite operators to book a portion of a payload on a Falcon 9 launch.  SpaceX's rocket has a relatively high payload capacity compared to the size of many of the small satellites produced today
column3: so a rideshare mission like this offers smaller companies and startups a chance to get their spacecraft in orbit without breaking the bank.  The cargo capsule atop the Falcon 9 flying today holds a total of 133 satellites according to SpaceX
column4: which is a new record for the highest number of satellites being launched on a single rocket – beating out a payload of 104 spacecraft delivered by Indian Space Research Organization's PSLV-C37 launch back in February 2017. #https://finance.yahoo.com/news/watch-spacex-launch-first-dedicated-141102174.html#faMkQXiaj

2021-01-21 21:11:11#tech#Puzzle Quest 3 is finally happening
column2: will be out later this year#https://www.pcgamer.com/puzzle-quest-3-is-finally-happening-will-be-out-later-this-year/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/uBscQuMM76zdxm7TBB6RWA-1200-80.jpg#en#0.0#www.pcgamer.com#"It's been more than a decade since the arrival of Puzzle Quest 2
column3: a mix of isometric roleplaying and match-3 gameplay that we described as ""brain-tickling puzzling in a fantasy wrapper"" in our 86/100 review.  That's a long time to wait for a sequel to such a well-received game
column4: but that wait is almost over: 505 Games announced today that Puzzle Quest 3 is in development and expected to be out later this year. Puzzle Quest 3 will tell an all-new RPG-infused tale in the land of Etheria
column5: set 500 years after the original game
column6: with its match-3 battle system upgraded with ""new and imaginative gameplay mechanics. "" It will be the first game in the series to be published by 505 Games
column7: which recently acquired developer Infinity Plus Two—previously known as Infinite Interactive
column8: the studio behind the first two games in the series—and will be free to play
column9: also a first for the series. ""After an overwhelming demand from fans over the past decade for the next instalment of Puzzle Quest
column10: we're thrilled to finally reveal the development of Puzzle Quest 3
column11: Infinity Plus Two CEO Steve Fawkner said.  ""The vision for this latest project has been years in the making
column12: and like any good Puzzle Quest game
column13: it's a delicate balance of gameplay
column14: story
column15: and strategic puzzle-solving while introducing something unexpected that will appeal to both old and new fans. ""That's a lot to put on the shoulders of a match-3 game
column16: but Puzzle Quest is really good (and still eminently playable
column17: if you're curious) and so I'm glad that a new one is finally on the way.  A date hasn't been set yet but 505 said it will be out later this year
column18: and in the meantime you can keep track of what's happening at puzzlequest3. com. "#https://www.pcgamer.com/puzzle-quest-3-is-finally-happening-will-be-out-later-this-year/#JdtOA54pQ

column2: as well as 10 more Starlink satellites

column1: 2021-01-21 20:09:14#business#United Sinks as Airline Says It Can’t Predict Rebound Timing#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/united-sinks-airline-keeps-mum-160948632.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/kJG6vaFQrOpoi1n0nDTubA--~B/aD02NzU7dz0xMjAwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_markets_842/8f016d5c84799b6f90ee232bb1eb928f#en#0.4215#finance.yahoo.com#(Bloomberg) -- United Airlines Holdings Inc.  sank after saying it couldn’t predict when a demand rebound would improve results
column2: a cautious outlook that contrasted with Delta Air Lines Inc. ’s forecast last week that it would break even on a cash-flow basis in the second quarter. This year will serve as a “transition” after the collapse in travel caused by the coronavirus pandemic
column3: United said as it reported fourth-quarter earnings.  While pent-up demand will spur more leisure bookings later this year
column4: United declined to bet on a specific timetable. “I know we’ve created a fair bit of angst amongst investors by not being willing to say that we think the inflection point on demand is right around the corner
column6: ” Chief Executive Officer Scott Kirby said Thursday on a conference call with analysts.  “And we hope it is
column7: but as we said from the beginning
column8: hope is not a strategy. ”Kirby’s caution underscored the risk for airlines in the coming months as the pandemic continues to gut travel demand.  Delta stirred hopes of an imminent rebound by offering specific goal posts last week
column9: reiterating its cash-flow outlook and telling investors that it had a “good shot” at turning a third-quarter profit as vaccines become more widely available. United slid 5. 2% to $42. 83 at 2:33 p. m.  in New York.  That was the biggest drop by far among major U. S.  airlines
column10: which fell less sharply as President Joe Biden’s administration said it planned to require air travelers to wear masks and would enforce quarantines for passengers arriving from other countries. 2023 GoalsInstead of shorter-term markers
column11: United touted its goal of topping pre-pandemic profit margins in 2023.  The company will eventually look back on 2020 as a crisis that enabled executives “to structurally change the airline for the better
column12: ” Kirby said. “Whether we reach an inflection point in the spring
column13: the summer or the fall
column14: what we know is that a recovery is coming
column15: ” he said. In the fourth quarter
column16: United swung to an adjusted loss of $7 a share
column17: 35 cents worse than the average of analyst estimates compiled by Bloomberg.  For all of 2020
column19: the largest shortfall in its 94-year history. First-quarter operating revenue will fall as much as 70%
column21: slightly worse than the drop of up to 65% that Delta projected.  Looking ahead
column22: United said it has identified $1. 4 billion in permanent cost cuts
column23: getting it more than halfway to its goal of $2 billion. ‘Inflection Point’The Chicago-based company said customers are eager to travel as Covid-19 vaccine distribution expands.  Consumers appear ready to research trips and travel later this year
column24: said Chief Commercial Officer Andrew Nocella. United expects leisure demand to rebound in the second half
column26: while business traffic will take 18 to 24 months to recover
column27: he said. The airline is also counting on international profits to outpace domestic performance.  Several carriers have culled large jets such as the Boeing Co.  747 and Airbus SE A380 from their schedules
column28: and Norwegian Air Shuttle ASA has scuttled its long-haul network. As a result
column30: capacity is likely to lag demand in many international markets once vaccines become widespread and border restrictions ease. “We do think there is a bunch of structural change there that will lead to stronger relative performance
column31: ” he said.  “And that should benefit United more than our competitors. ”(Updates with CEO comment in third paragraph)For more articles like this
column32: please visit us at bloomberg. comSubscribe now to stay ahead with the most trusted business news source. ©2021 Bloomberg L. P. #https://finance.yahoo.com/news/united-sinks-airline-keeps-mum-160948632.html#nQ1Z6rx35

Markets across the world surged on Wednesday
column3: with the Dow gaining more than 258 points
column4: the S&P 500 up 1. 4% and the Nasdaq up nearly 2%. Former President Donald Trump was anti-immigration
column5: pro-fossil fuel and hostile toward China
column6: said CNBC ""Mad Money"" host Jim Cramer.  In contrast
column8: against fossil fuels and much softer on China
column9: he said.  With a new administration in charge
column10: the U. S.  should see a change in the speed of the coronavirus vaccine rollout
column11: the CNBC host said.  The issue with vaccine rollout is that the federal government gave those involved in the distribution process the same amount of power in deciding what vaccines went where
column13: when everyone is in charge
column14: nobody is in charge. "" Here's what Jim Cramer says is ahead in 2021 with Biden in the White House:E-Commerce: The pandemic accelerated the growth of e-commerce
column15: and consumers in 2021 will not slow down on ordering from the comfort of their home
column16: Cramer said.  Companies like Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN)
column17: and Walmart (NYSE: WMT) have only just begun
column18: he said.  Travel and Leisure: Once there is an effective vaccine distribution plan
column20: helping companies like Marriott (NASDAQ: MAR) and Airbnb (NASDAQ: ABNB)
column22: airlines and companies like Boeing (NYSE: BA)
column23: the CNBC host said.  Digitization and Cybersecurity: With more technological advancements to come in the cloud realm
column24: Cramer said companies like Servicenow (NYSE: NOW)
column26: and cybersecurity companies such as Okta (NASDAQ: OKTA)
column27: will all be successful plays in 2021. 5G: A massive worldwide shortage exists of semiconductors allowing for massive growth from chip makers such as Qualcomm (NASDAQ: QCOM) and Intel Corp.  (NASDAQ: INTC) as well as growth from cellphone service providers including T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS). COVID-19 Stimulus: With another round of stimulus payments expected to soon be in the hands of Americans
column30: Amazon and Target (NYSE: TGT) could see upticks in their first-quarter earnings and continued growth through the year. China: In Cramer's view
column31: Biden is soft on China and companies that are already established in the atmosphere there like Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL)
column32: Nike (NYSE: NKE) and Starbucks (NASDAQ: SBUX) will benefit. Wealth Management: Last year represented a surge for wealth and asset management companies such as Goldman Sachs (NYSE: GS)
column34: Cramer said. Morgan Stanley was able to capitalize on a new generation of investors who believe that picking your own stocks is a ""good way to manage your money
column35: he said.  Remote work: Even with the end of the pandemic on the horizon
column36: remote work is here to stay
column37: Cramer said.  For the last 10 months
column38: millions of white collar employees have worked from home
column39: and eh said studies show that their productivity rose. Companies such as Zoom (NASDAQ: ZM)
column40: and Amazon will benefit from the creation of more elaborate home offices
column41: he said.  Health Care: Biden doesn't have the votes in Congress to change much in regards to health care
column43: adding that an effort is likely to try to make health insurance cheaper for working class Americans
column44: boosting companies like Centene (NYSE: CNC) and Humana (NYSE: HUM). Electric Vehicles: With the Democratic Party being strong on fighting climate change
column45: Cramer said people will start to purchase more electric vehicles. Companies like Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) and the manufacturers merging with special acquisition companies will see unparalleled growth
column46: he said. General Motors (NYSE: GM) could also see a strong growth year due to its investment in EV manufacturer Rivian
column47: Cramer said.  Housing: With Biden planning on extending policies allowing more freedom for undocumented immigrants
column48: Cramer said millions of people could get credit to buy new homes
